pages.text:
CHAMBER NETWORKING EVENTS
Chamber Networking Events
are thoughtfully scheduled at various times throughout the month to provide flexibility and accommodate the diverse needs of our business community. These events are designed to create meaningful opportunities for professionals to connect, collaborate, and grow. Whether you're looking to explore new business prospects, share innovative marketing strategies, or simply expand your network, our events offer the ideal setting to engage with like-minded individuals and businesses that serve your geographic area.
Each networking group is unique in its focus, size, and meeting schedule, allowing you to find the one that best complements your business goals or works within your busy calendar. These gatherings are more than just meet-and-greetsâthey are dynamic forums where lasting partnerships are formed, referrals are shared, and valuable insights are exchanged.
We encourage you to attend a few of our events to discover which group best fits your needs and objectives. No matter where you are in your business journey, these events can be a valuable resource. And rememberâyou never know who you might meet or what opportunities might arise!
Something for Everyone!
Chamber After 5 (CA5)
As our premiere, evening event, CA5 is a great opportunity for our members who can't attend our daytime functions.Â  Hosted by the chamber staff, come learn about your membership while meeting some new and familiar faces.Â  This event takes place on the first Tuesday of every month from 5:30 pm - 7:00 pm and is held at a location in Oviedo or Winter Springs.Â  Check the event calendar for the location each month and to sign up.
OWS Business Alliance
We've taken OBA and WSBA and combined them!Â  During this lunch event, you can meet the staff and fellow business professionals.Â  We meet the 3rd Monday of the month from 11:30 am - 1:00 pm at various locations in the Oviedo and Winter Springs area.Â  Check the event calendar for the location each month and to sign up to attend.Â  Food specials will be available.
WIN - Women's Inspiration Network
The Women's Inspiration Network is our women's networking group that will focus on supporting women in business. We'll have monthly meetings with a guest speaker or two, group volunteer days and fun outing events such as Beach Day, Golfing, a Holiday Party and more!
Previously termed Oviedo Businesswomen Network (OBN), this group is presented in 2025 by AdventHealth and Boltz Legal, and was established in 1997. WIN consists of area businesswomen who meet monthly.Â  Come network, enjoy a delicious catered lunch at the Oviedo Park Pub from 11:30 am - 1:00 pm the second Wednesday of each month. Sign up each month, bring a friend!
OWS Coffee Hour
Come enjoy a cup of coffee with your favorite chamber staff!Â  We meet on the third Thursday of each month from 9:00 am - 10:00 am at various locations in the Oviedo and Winter Springs area.Â  Check the event calendar for the location each month and to sign up to join us.
View This Months Schedule

BOARD OF DIRECTORS
The volunteer leadership of the Oviedo-Winter Springs Regional Chamber of Commerce encourages enthusiastic participation and provides direction for the programs and services provided for the chamberâs membership. Board members serve a vital role in establishing policy and shaping the direction of the chamber and are reflective of the diversity that defines our regionâs business community.
The Board meets on the 2nd Tuesday of every month in order to review and approve internal documents and procedures, establish policies and protocol, and perform any other duties deemed to be in the best interest of the chamber and its members.

Memberships & Benefits
In striving to create a robust business climate within our region, the Oviedo-Winter Springs Regional Chamber of Commerce serves as a an advocate for business and civic interests within our communities. We are a private, 501 (c) (6) not-for-profit business membership association. The chamber is an action-oriented organization dedicated to serving the needs of our businesses and community as a whole. With many networking activities, educational seminar offerings, and promotional opportunities, our member companies capitalize on the contacts and resources provided by the chamber. Membership is done on a âfair shareâ basis, meaning Standard Membership rates are based upon the number of âfull timeâ employees at the particular business.
Networking Opportunities
Whether it is our Quarterly Membership Luncheons, Networking Events, After Hours Gatherings, Ribbon-Cuttings, our Two Signature Festivals, or our Educational Workshops, you will get to know new people and expand your prospect base.
Chamber Events and Programs
Chamber events provide members with opportunities to market their business in the community. Events are a fun way to help members meet potential customers, clients and vendors.
Increased Visibility
You can increase positive perception among consumers and business owners when you're identified as a member of the Oviedo-Winter Springs Regional Chamber
Boosted Online Recognition
Being a member of the OWS chamber substantiates your organization through Google. Chamber members have a built in website through our website that increases your Search Engine Optimization (SEO).
Advocacy
We help develop and promote a favorable business climate by bringing awareness to members of issues within our region.
Standard Membership*
Every successful business journey starts with a strong foundation. Our Standard Membership is designed to provide you with the essential tools and connections to build, grow, and thrive. Starting at $300 a year, this tier is your gateway to
empowerment
, giving you access to vital resources, educational workshops, and a vibrant network of peers.
Â
By joining, you align your business with a community built onÂ
integrity
, signaling to customers and partners that you are a trusted part of our local economy. This is the essential first step toward greater visibility, credibility, and success.
Â

Collaborators** | $1,000
Where connection becomes action -
For a commitment of $1000, this level is for members who are ready to move beyond networking and into meaningful partnership. It is founded on the idea that true growth comes from shared effortâlaunching joint ventures, tackling community-wide challenges, and creating new opportunities through strategic alliances. As a Collaborator, you are at the center of this dynamic ecosystem, helping to drive collective success and amplify your own impact.

Partners** | $5,000
A Commitment to Leadership and Impact
-
The Partner's level is more than a membership; it is a strategic investment in premier leadership and community-wide progress. For an annual commitment of $5,000, our Partners gain unparalleled access and visibility, positioning their brand at the forefront of our region's most important conversations and initiatives.
Â
This tier is designed for leaders whose vision extends beyond their own enterprise to the prosperity of our entire community. Your investment directly fuels the Chamberâs most critical workâfrom economic advocacy to workforce developmentâallowing you to actively shape the business landscape and leave a lasting, measurable impact. Partner with us to not only elevate your organization but to become a driving force for a thriving economy.

Allies** | $10,000
The Pinnacle of Community Leadership
Â
At the summit of community leadership stands the Allies tier. This is the pinnacle of membership, reserved for the preeminent organizations whose influence and vision define our region's path forward. For a $10,000 annual commitment, Allies assume a highly visible mantle of leadership, acting as the principal champions of our business community.
Â
All eyes turn to our Allies. They are the standard-bearers, leading withÂ
integrity

excellence

empower

The Membership That Gives Back
Â
This membership is dedicated to the organizations that serve our community withÂ
compassion
Â and drive meaningfulÂ
impact
. It is designed to provide essential resources, visibility, and connections to the business community that help you advance your mission and continue your vital work. This tier recognizes the dedication to your work. In return for all you give, we provide a platform to raise your visibility, attract supporters, and find corporate partners who want to help you succeed. Let us be your strategic ally in advancing your mission and creating a stronger community for everyone.
Â

ABOUT US
Oviedo Winter Springs Chamber of Commerce
The Oviedo-Winter Springs Regional
Chamber of Commerce (OWSRCC) is
dedicated to bringing value to our
community by empowering businesses,
helping them grow, and supporting
economic development.
We are committed to operational
excellence, meaning we will run the
Chamber in a way that is effective,
transparent, and built to last. Every
initiative, event, and service will be
designed with a clear goal: to deliver
value, empower businesses, and help
build a stronger local economy.
â
MISSON
To bring value to our community by empowering businesses, fostering
growth, and driving economic development.
â
VISION
To bring value to our community by empowering businesses, fostering
growth, and driving economic development.
â
CORE VALUES
Integrity
â
We act honestly and openly.
â

â
We do our best in everything we do.
â

â

impact.
â

lift up
businesses
and individuals.
â

â
We focus on results that matter to
our members and community.
â

â

community.
â
Community Values:
Our community value strategy is built on four key pillars that guide our
programs and initiatives:
Business Growth & Visibility
Workforce & Economic Empowerment
Sustainability & Operational Excellenceâ
Community Engagement & Compassion
The Oviedo-Winter Springs Regional Chamber of Commerce is a private, 501 (c) (6) not-for-profit business membership association established in 1982 and serving the community for over 40+ years. The chamber is an action-oriented organization dedicated to serving the needs of our businesses and community as a whole. With many networking activities, educational seminar offerings, and promotional opportunities, our member companies capitalize on the contacts and resources provided by the OWSRCC.
If you are a current member, thank you and we truly appreciate your investment. If you are considering membership, please explore the membership benefits, ways to promote your business and all the committees and networking opportunities we have to offer.
Please do not hesitate to contact us at any time with any questions you may have regarding membership or any other service that the chamber provides.

CHAMBER STAFF
At the Chamber, we are deeply committed to supporting both you and our broader community. Our mission is to be a trusted partner in your journey toward success, whether you're launching a new venture, growing your existing business, or seeking new opportunities to connect and thrive. We take great pride in upholding the highest standards of excellence in everything we do, and weâre here to provide the resources, guidance, and collaborative spirit you need to reach your goals. Your success is our success, and weâre honored to work alongside you every step of the way.
Johana Ramirez
President CEO
With over 10 years as a CEO and more than 20 years of building trusted business relationships, Johana brings a proven track record of leadership, strategic growth, and financial excellence. She has successfully led organizations with teams of over 1,000 employees, fostering high-performance cultures and sustainable success.
Her vision and expertise now drive the chamberâs mission to foster economic development, empower businesses, and support meaningful growth. Under Johanaâs leadership, the chamber is advancing its bold goal to become the most inspirational chamber of commerce in Florida and beyond.
Contact info:
(407) 365-6500
Jramirez@owsrcc.org
Truchard Bien-Aime
Membership Director
Truchard brings over 10 years of experience building successful membership programs across the technology, professional services, and wealth management sectors. She holds an MBA in Project Management and is skilled at designing value-driven experiences that foster lasting connections.
Truchard is dedicated to creating an environment where every member is empowered to grow, contribute, and be part of something bigger.
Contact info:
Tbien-aime@owsrcc.org
Kaleo Phoenix
Event Coordinator
Kaleo Phoenix is the new Event Coordinator for the Oviedo Winter Springs Regional Chamber of Commerce. A proud graduate of UCFâs Rosen College of Hospitality Management, Kaleo specialized in Entertainment Management. With a strong educational foundation, a passion for live events, and a deep commitment to community impact, Kaleo is eager to create meaningful experiences that foster growth, opportunity, and connection throughout the region.
Contact info:
Kphoenix@owsrcc.org
Rube Rodriguez
Marketing Coordinator
Rube is a results-driven marketing professional with over a decade of expertise in digital strategy, creative direction, and visual content production. With a passion for helping businesses elevate their brand presence, Rube specializes in crafting impactful marketing campaigns, engaging social media content, building impactful websites and compelling event promotions. From strategic advertising to creative storytelling, Rube delivers the tools and vision needed to drive growth and make your business stand out.
Contact info:
Rrodriguez@owsrcc.org
Staci Vanderwoude
Admin Coordinator
Staci brings over 20 years of experience in administrative management and operations.Â She holds a degree in Business and Information Management and has a proven track record of streamlining processes while ensuring compliance and efficiency. A proud Oviedo resident for 16 years, Staci has a deep heart for the community and is passionate about supporting the Chamberâs mission. She is committed to aligning everything the Chamber does with its core mission and vision of driving growth, connection, and success throughout the region.
Contact info:
Svanderwoude@owsrcc.org
